text.__SUMMARY__: Campanula barbata, common name bearded bellflower, is a species of perennial bellflower in the family Campanulaceae.
text.Description: Campanula barbata can reach a height of 20–30 centimetres (7.9–11.8 in). This plant produces a small basal rosette of grayish-green leaves, simple, lanceolate with dentate margins and alternate. It has racemes of nodding, pale blue to deep blue campanulate flowers, which are hairy inside (hence the Latin name barbata, meaning bearded). They bloom from June to August.
text.Distribution: This species is native to Norway, France, Italy and Central Europe.
text.Habitat: It can be found in mountain regions at an elevation 1,100–2,600 metres (3,600–8,500 ft) above sea level.
text.References: Christoper Brickell (Editor-in-chief): RHS A-Z Encyclopedia of Garden Plants. Third edition. Dorling Kindersley, London 2003
